column4: Not uless you plan to upgrade to the next Ubuntu version. I removed that meta package a while ago and everything is fine
why would I not be able to upgrade?
You just need to re-install ubuntu-desktop , then upgrade
Ah, what happens if it isn't installed when I upgrade or will it just not let me?
Not sure, never tried
When you open synaptic and hit the reload button, usually there will be a new entry like "New in repositories"
erm, where will that new entry be?
Hit the Status button at the bottom and it will be in with the Install, Not Installed, stuff
Only has All, Installed, Installed (local or obsolete), Not Installed, Not Installed (residual config)
Yes, that is the right sectin.. on mine it shows up there *if* there are new apps in the repos
Ah, erm, I kinda want a list of stuff like, added by date though... heh
pff, I was hacking Amigas at 6
Doesn't work for me
Evolution and Firefox both clear the clipboard for me
Any idea why klipper makes a little window for its systray icon rather than going into the REAL systray?
No idea, I don't use kde apps
, gnomefreak , minerale , See the section "Clipboard" here:  http://www.gnome.org/start/2.12/notes/en/rnusers.html
Well no matter what it says, it still doesn't work
That would make me think that your gnome is somehow broken.
and most other people in this channel apparently, and my other PC....
Evolution does it too. I think that IS part of Gnome
